analytic.title: Neue Heimat für wenige Generationen: Die AssyrerInnen in Syrien und ihre kurdischen NachbarInnen

biblStruct.note: After the Semele massacre, several thousand Assyrians fled to the French mandate territory of Syria, where they founded new villages along the Khabur River and laid the foundation for the Assyrian minority in Syria today. This article gives a brief outline of the history of this Assyrian enclave and deals with the relationship of the Assyrian political actors with the Autonomous Administration of Northern and Eastern Syria founded by the kurdish Democratic Union Party and thus the question of how far the Assyrians are also integrated in it.
